newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian sugar prices rise on fresh consumer demand.
newsitem.headline: Indian sugar prices rise on fresh consumer demand.

text.p: Sugar prices rose on fresh consumer buying against a limited supply on Thursday, dealers said.
Ready sugar S-30 gained 5.0/7.0 rupees to 1,430/1,465 per quintal (100 kg) while M-30 moved up 5.0/10 rupees to 1,470/1,505 per quintal.
Mill delivery S-30 rose 5.0/10 to 1,375/1,390 rupees per quintal while M-30 made a similar gain to 1,395/1,420 per quintal.
Traders said they expected a narrow movement in prices in the coming days.
